title: Global BMC Tax Leader
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  

The Brand Marketing and Communications (BMC) function has an important role to play in helping to achieve EY’s ambition to create long-term value as the world’s most trusted and distinctive professional services organization. BMC works in collaboration with the business to take services and solutions to market; bring EY’s purpose, ‘Building a better working world,’ to life for our people, clients and communities; engage EY people and build a high performing culture; and to build the commercial value and emotional resonance of the EY brand.

  

BMC comprises around 2,000 professionals, working across the Executive and Regions in the following capabilities: Brand and Client Experiences; Marketing; PR/Media Relations & External Communications; Internal Communications & People Engagement; Corporate communications.

  

BMC also includes teams who are responsible for content development, editorial, analyst relations, alliances, digital channels, events-staging, strategy, planning and operations. Through the collective power of BMC, and the other teams and specialists we work with, BMC aims to build a better working world by driving commercial value through distinctive marketing and communications that deliver measurable impact.  

Tax is one of EY’s four global service lines and is one of the fastest growing. Tax delivers services and solutions to help clients thrive in an era of rapid change, combining people and technology to help organizations meet their business goals.

  

The Global Tax BMC leader helps translate Global Tax business priorities into marketing and communications strategies and programs and plays a critical leadership role in integrating programs across Tax, with sectors and Growth Markets (GM) and with other service lines. The role works closely with the Global Tax Executive in developing and executing the BMC plan, and ensuring that Tax is fully represented within global firmwide BMC-related activities.

  

The role will oversee brand initiatives as they relate to Tax and will need to establish and demonstrate EY’s value proposition through cross-sector, sector and buyer programs and work closely with the Global leadership to integrate an internal communication and change management strategy and the help drive effective execution of engagement programs.

  

A member of the both the Global BMC leadership team and the Global Tax Executive, the role has responsibility for leading the Tax BMC team and requires an experienced and resilient team player with inclusive people leadership skills. Strong relationships and collaborate skills are essential. A globally dispersed team of over 20 people report to this leader and it oversees a network of BMC professionals supporting Tax BMC activities in each of the 23 Regions.

  

Success in this role requires the creation of a strategy to enable the delivery of world-class brand, marketing and communications programs that help deliver revenue, reputation and relationship outcomes. Success will be measured through EY’s global brand survey, through pipeline and sales metrics, analyst ratings and people engagement measures.

 **Major responsibilities/duties**

  

The role is accountable for developing an integrated strategic global Tax brand, marketing and communications plan that drives revenue, relationships and reputation goals, working closely with the Tax leadership. This includes;

  

* Increasing the global market awareness of EY’s Tax capabilities
* Creating and delivering innovative campaigns to increase market share and revenue for new solutions, services and products
* Delivering high impact client experiences through digital channels, events and third-party collaborations
* Supporting strategy execution and people engagement through developing and executing an impactful internal communications and engagement plan
* Integration of EY’s purpose and corporate messaging into Tax internal and external communications across paid, earned and owned channels to strengthen brand equity and audience engagement
* Delivering integrated communications strategies for media and other significant stakeholders such as analysts, business organizations, alumni and potential recruits
* Adopting new ideas and technology to enable impactful audience-centric communications and operational effectiveness, eg marketing automation, AI
* Leveraging data and analytics to drive insights; developing and implementing metrics to measure results of marketing strategies; providing analysis and recommendations to support continuous growth, improved execution and team development
* Sharing expert knowledge in brand, marketing and communications issues, trends and long-term implications for EY
* Providing input from the Tax perspective to firmwide program development
* Contribute successfully to the firm-wide Alliances strategy, with differential focus on SAP, Microsoft and IBM (tbc)
* Drive change, ensuring that the BMC function is responding to market opportunities and business priorities
* Work closely with the other BMC senior leaders to drive performance goals of improving service delivery, quality and cost efficiency of the function. Managing Agency relationships and budget responsibility

  

Culture, people leadership and operational excellence

  

* Fosters a culture that respects diversity and inclusiveness and rewards and supports creativity and innovation within the BMC team
* Builds and lead a high-performing team and act as counsellor, mentor and coach
* Drives change, ensuring that the BMC function is responding to market opportunities and business priorities

  

The position holder will perform other responsibilities and tasks as required to achieve the agreed performance outcomes.

 **Qualifications, knowledge and experience**  

**Objectives/measures**

  

The key measures of success for the role include:

  

* Qualitative: quality, accuracy and timeliness of advice; 360-degree feedback
* Quantitative: share of voice, analyst reports, brand surveys and people surveys
* Campaign outcomes including, brand measures and lead generation

 **Experience Requirements**

  

* Proven ability to manage complex processes and/or projects at a global level
* A minimum of 15 years’ experience in B2B marketing, with substantial experience of the Tax business; acknowledged expertise in either marketing or communications for Tax (or both)
* Demonstrate a deep understanding of the Tax business and how to build brand strategies that help it achieve its objectives; act as a trusted advisor to the Tax leadership team
* Outstanding communication abilities, which are required to connect the dots across the organization
* Experience leading relationship-building and revenue-generating programs within a people organization with proven and demonstrable results, working closely with business development functions
* Deep and current expertise in brand and digital marketing, and ability to convey this expertise to support others to progress
* Experience of both global and local roles within a people organization with proven and demonstrable results
* Proven leadership capabilities, experience leading and managing large, diverse and virtual high-performance teams
* Proven ability to influence and build collaborative relationships with senior-level stakeholders

 **Other Requirements**

  

* This role can be located in London or New York (tbc)
* Global travel is required


**What we offer**

The compensation ranges below are provided in order to comply with United States pay transparency laws. Other geographies will follow their local salary guidelines, which may not be a direct conversion of published US salary ranges.

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $254,500 to $490,000. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $305,500 to $556,800. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

  

EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

description:
### **When you join Verizon**


You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the V Team Life.

### **What you’ll be doing...**


Administration and oversight of Verizon involvement with municipal reconstruction projects - sewers, water mains, bridges in NYC: Interface with various New York City and New York State government agencies to engineer alternatives to eliminate and/or minimize interference with manhole and conduit infrastructure; re-design/re-engineer municipal structures and facilities; negotiate with NYC municipal contractors to perform municipal interference work at fair market costs. Responsible for a municipal budget of $60M. Additionally, Administration and oversight of multiple Vendors constructing, maintaining, and responding to emergency situations involving Conduit, Manholes, and Trenches. Responsible for a construction budget of $20M. You will be responsible for managing a team of 14 Direct Reports and 38 Agency Reports.

### **What we’re looking for...**

### **You’ll need to have:**

* Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience.
* Minimum of 5 years’ experience in Telecommunications infrastructure construction and maintenance.
* Demonstrated experience dealing with Municipal Contractors.
* Demonstrated experience dealing with NYC Department of Design and Construction, NYC Economic Development Corp. and other NYC government agencies.
* Knowledge of methods of municipal construction including excavation, trenching, sheeting.
* Ability to read and interpret construction plans and specifications.
* Ability to work with construction superintendents and professional engineers.
* Ability to act independently, make rational judgements and negotiate binding agreements.
* Strong negotiation, communication and cost estimating skills.

### **Even better if you have one or more of the following:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering / Construction Management or relevant experience.
* Professional Engineers License.
* Experience with communication systems.
* Experience with MS Word, Excel & Gmail.
* Strong organizational, time-priority management and results-driven leadership skills.
* Knowledge of employment/labor laws and prepare cost estimates based on Prevailing Wages.
* Knowledge of NYC Construction procedures and practices and construction specifications.
* Knowledge of Joint Bidding contract language and processes.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.


Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. Candidates for year-round positions are reviewed on a rolling basis. Applications will be accepted up to 90 days after the posting date, or until the position is filled (whichever is first).

 **Job Summary:**  

The Director, Community Affairs Business Partner (CABP) position is responsible for developing Community Affairs strategy and ensuring integrated execution across the Public Affairs operating model to drive growth and profitability at Vail Resorts. This role will focus on collaborating with resort leadership to deliver the business strategy, utilizing external insights and organization data to drive business outcomes, that solve for local or regional priorities in an enterprise-wide, scalable manner. This position formulates partnerships across the Public Affairs function to deliver value-added service to leadership that reflects the business objectives of the organization. The CABP maintains an effective level of business literacy and understands the business unit's financial position, its strategy, culture, and competition as the foundation for their community engagement strategy.

  

This role sits within the Public Affairs Department and will report to the VP of Community and Government Affairs with a focus on public affairs at the community level in the Western and Eastern Regions including British Columbia, Lake Tahoe, the Midwest, Pennsylvania, New York, New Hampshire, and Vermont)]. The business partner will work directly with mountain resort leadership to both facilitate and conduct direct outreach.

  

The ideal candidate is a dynamic individual with demonstrated strategic experience planning and leading external affairs programs and projects across a variety of stakeholders including the ability to influence others aligned with our Company values, business priorities, and specific objectives.

 **The most successful CABPs have the following traits and competencies:**

* Partners cross-functionally to develop a holistic proactive approach to community engagement.
* Thinks strategically, applying business insights to formulate and drive integrated external engagement solutions that achieve organizational objectives.
* Strong learning agility. Enjoys and excels in environments where he/she must tackle and solve new and increasingly complex strategic business challenges and issues.
* An ability to build long-term, trusting relationships that position Vail Resorts for growth.
* Has strong emotional intelligence and the ability to influence both internally and externally.
* Confidence to have a strong point of view and express it even if it proves unpopular.
* Champions the Vail Resorts culture, while embracing regional and cultural differences.

 **Job Responsibilities**

* Develop and lead Public Affairs strategies for pursuing and achieving business priorities within resort communities, including advocacy for and management of special projects and other issue management.
* Develop and manage relationships for the company with an initial focus on local communities in alignment with our Community & Government Affairs strategy.
* Analyze external trends and community engagement against business priorities with resort leadership to align on integrated Public Affairs solutions.
* Maintain situational awareness of key stakeholder and policy developments and help to make strategic recommendations on issues that may impact the Company.
* Represent Vail Resorts externally.
* Collaborate cross-functionally inside Vail Resorts.
* Partner closely across the Public Affairs Department which includes the Public Relations and Communications team, the Environmental & Social Responsibility team, and the Government Affairs team focused on state and national affairs.
* Partner with resort leadership to support and facilitate their external engagement and business priorities.
* Act as a conduit between Public Affairs and Vail Resorts business units, appropriately communicating priorities and emerging issues to drive collaborative decision making and solutions.
* Direct management of Community Analyst role
* Maintain the operating budget for the Community & Government Affairs team.

 **Job Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree
* Minimum 6-12 years of work experience, ideally with a background in government affairs, regulatory/government entities, intergovernmental associations, or non-governmental organizations (NGO), or coming from the business side with a background in Marketing, Communications, Strategy, Operations, or a customer-facing role
* Minimum 3 years supervisory experience
* Demonstrated ability to lead through ambiguity by making the complex simple.
* Experience developing integrated strategy and project managing with (and leading) cross-functional teams collaboratively.
* Organized and self-motivated; able to prioritize and manage multiple tasks to meet the demands of a fast-paced and shifting environment
* Strategic thinking with strong written and verbal communication, (writing samples may be requested).
* Ability to engage credibly with senior executives to inspire confidence and influence.
* Passion for doing good, leading teams, serving others, and driving value in an environment that is safe, inclusive, and fun.
* High-level creative thinker with the confidence to use it; proactively seeks out newer, better ways to get things done, using existing resources and creating efficiencies

  



The expected Total Compensation for this role is $111,900 - $151,320 + annual bonus + equit. Individual compensation decisions are based on a variety of factors.

* Ski/Mountain Perks! Free passes for employees, employee discounted lift tickets for friends and family AND free ski lessons
* MORE employee discounts on lodging, food, gear, and mountain shuttles
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Employee Assistance Program
* Excellent training and professional development


Full Time roles are eligible for the above, plus:

* Health Insurance; Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, and Vision Insurance plans (for eligible seasonal employees after working 500 hours)
* Free ski passes for dependents
* Critical Illness and Accident plans

* Starting Rate $25.00/hour

* A dynamic work environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Ongoing Job Training
* Group Health Coverage
* Full-timers get 80 hours Paid Time Off Annually
* Part-timers get 40 hours Paid Time Off Annually
* Short/ Long Term Disability
* Ancillary Health Benefits from AFLAC


**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* A BA will visit the client at home or in the community to provide relief to caregivers and holistic support to youth.


* Our BA’s typically work 2-20 hours weekly in 2-4 hour shifts starting after 3:00pm during the school year and as early as 8:30am during the summer. Services are available any day of the week to accommodate the scheduling needs of our clients.


* Individual Support Plan development and implementation


* Delivery and monitoring of behavior analysis services


* Submission of weekly clinical progress notes, within 24 hours of service provision Intake Data Assessments


* Data collection and display (e.g., graphics) as authorized by a recipient’s behavioral analysis service plan


* Compliance with service authorization, including time frames and service hours


* Implement interventions in the Individual Support Plan


* Implementation of behavioral procedures for the acquisition of replacement skills reduction of problematic behaviors


* Carry out treatment as designated by the supervising behavior analyst which includes:


* Facilitating environmental arrangements.


* Using proactive strategies.


* Teaching and developing new skills.


* Managing specific consequences for behavior based on function.


* Must be willing to work with the child or youth to increase ADL (Assisted Daily Living) skills within their home as well as during community outings.


* Assist parent/guardian in the implementation of the treatment plan.


* Assist the behavior analyst in the training of caregivers and/or staff.


* Crisis prevention, recognition, and intervention.


* Ensure all agency policies are implemented and followed.


* Participate in required training.


**Skills/Abilities:**
* Active Listening & Critical Thinking.
* Positive leadership.
* Patience & Understanding.
* Compassion.
* Adaptability.
* Reliability & Attentiveness.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Understanding of evidence-based interventions for individuals with behavioral and developmental disabilities..
* Willing to be a positive role model and provide emotional & psychological support to clients.
* Knowledge of behavioral interventions.


**Qualifications:**
* Must have completed free CSOC Behavioral Assistant Certification course or be able to complete within 6 months of hire... For more information: https://www.nj.gov/dcf/providers/csc/training/ ..
* Bachelor’s Degree in psychology or related field.
* 2-4 years experience in behavioral healthcare (maladaptive behaviors).
* 2-4 years experience working with children with disabilities (developmental/intellectual disabilities, mental illness).
